question: Which language day is celebrated by the United Nations on June 6, the birthday of famous poet Alexander Pushkin?
explanation:
UN celebrates six separate language days to raise awareness of the history, culture and development of each of its six official languages  - English, Arabic, Spanish, Chinese, Russian and French.
June 6 is celebrated as the UN Russian Language Day, which is also the birthday of the great Russian poet Alexander Pushkin. The poet is considered as the father of modern Russian literature. Some of his popular literary works include novel titled “Eugene Onegin” and his poem titled “The Bronze Horseman”.
